item.title: WoW Arduino Fisher
item.description: So… I made a thing. DISCLAIMER: This project is intended only as a learning exercise. Don’t use it to take advantage in the game, and don’t try it on Blizz’s live servers. Automation of gameplay is against the rules, and you could lose your account. Try it on a private server if you wish to see it working. Having said that, let me start by telling you the motivation behind this idea.

item.title: Windows XP on a Dell Optiplex 380
item.description: What’s the best way to enjoy some free time off work? By spending hours working on a dumb old computer! So, I was in need for an Windows XP era machine to play with some old games source code, and got my hands on this little Dell machine: the desktop version of the Dell Optiplex 380. Mine is the model on the middle - sorry about the low quality, this is the biggest image that I found.

item.title: SDL2, VMware, Linux and Relative Mouse Mode
item.description: So, one of my pet projects is a game engine based on a 3D Software Renderer (that I will post about some other day). One night, while I was working on it implementing an FPS camera, I started getting strange results when moving the mouse. My development setup for this kind of stuff consisted on a VM running Fedora XFCE Spin, where I would code using CLion, build and execute the program.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Hey there! Welcome to my website! I know that this “Hello, World!” thing is really cliche, but I couldn’t miss the opportunity :P Anyway, seriously now! My name is Rodrigo Verdiani (aka Roverdi), and I’m a Brazilian developer. You can find more about me on the about section. On this website I hope to post some stuff that I’m currently messing with, but for the moment I’m still working on structuring this blog.

item.title: ABOUT
item.description: Hey there! My name is Rodrigo Verdiani (aka Roverdi), and this is my blog :D I’m a twentyish (okay, almost thirty xD) years old Brazilian developer, with a passion for programming. My main game/tech interests are (in no particular order): Graphics Programming Engine Programming AI Retro tech Besides that, some of my hobbies are: Role Playing Games Electronics (mainly audio stuff and old digital tech, like Z80s, 6502, etc) Music Photography Cars and planes mechanic The main idea behind this website is to share things that I learn, love and(or) may be useful for others.
